# ALBATROSS-CLASS CARGO SHUTTLE

[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 2-5

"A very large, heavy-duty cargo-hauling shuttle designed by the USSP-based Kesha Aerospace Plant, featuring modular pod storage and a robust salvage bay for supplanting freight work with small-scale mining operations. Expensive, but its very high-density cargo stowage makes it worth it for those with the money to invest."
"End-user modifiable!"
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the SMES units are anchored to the floor. - Check that the shuttle's APC units have their breakers toggled On.
## 1.2. S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit
- Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generators units are anchored to the floor. - Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generators units has fuel. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation during flight. - Check that the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generators units are set to HV output. - Set the Target Power on both units for 35 [bold]kW[/bold]. This will ensure there is no power deficit; the running power draw with thrusters enabled is 67.3kw. - Start the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generators units.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that the oxygen and nitrogen canisters are anchored to their respective connector ports. - Check that the mixer unit is set to 101kPa. - Check that the gas mixer is set to the correct mixing ratio (22% Oxygen, 78% Nitrogen). - Enable the mixer unit.
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Ensure that the waste loop pipes are all properly installed. - Ensure the waste loop pump is powered and enabled. It is located under the catwalk next to the power storage units.
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
